metadata.bijbeltekst: Amos 5:18–24; Matthew 25:1–13 (Parable of the Ten Virgins)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters the chaos and darkness of the world through the incarnation and crucifixion of Christ to overcome sin and death, establishing a 'transcendent narrative' that offers hope beyond random suffering.

tekstueel_bewijs: God submitted himself to the very worst that human sin could do
on the third day he was raised victorious over evil and death
the same hand that reached out to heal the sick
to save the world from sin and death
Christian hope builds its foundation on the promise of the living God

zender.identificatie: The Living God / The Liturgical Season (Advent)
tekstueel_bewijs: the promise of the living God
the approach of the liturgical New Year

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Church / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: to save the world from sin and death

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied) / The 'Premium Oil' of Faith
tekstueel_bewijs: We need premium oil for our lamps
the white flat face of Death
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but the 'Void,' 'Death,' and 'Malign Giants'—forces no human effort can thwart.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer maintains the 'lamp' of faith through costly action and witness while waiting for the Bridegroom.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly presented as the 'only thing that testifies' to the truth of the primary program (soteriology).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God submitted himself to the very worst
The coming of Jesus calls every mortal arrangement into question
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We need to face up to the horrors

voorbeelden: It is a call we cannot afford to ignore
What sort of witness do we want to make?
We need to understand the difference between optimism and hope
There is no one who is unable to offer a costly sacrifice
The only thing that can stand up to the scrutiny

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of the Gospel to withstand chaos, and the subsequent 'Power' given to the believer to act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the false security of affluent suburbia (~S1) to the terror of the Void (S2), then through the reality of chaos (~S2), finally landing on Hope (S1) via the Cross.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the Paradox of the Cross: God enters S2 to establish S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the 'Void' and 'Death' are treated as ontological realities.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there are strong ethical imperatives, they are grounded in the 'transcendent narrative' where God is the primary actor who defeats cosmic opponents.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on human effort to 'keep lamps burning'
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: what can you and I do... to keep our lamps burning?

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of the Atonement
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The only begotten Son of God came down himself, and the storm broke over his head

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jonathan Daniels and medical missionaries are used as models of the 'premium oil' of faith.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon avoids pure exemplarism by stating these lives only 'testify' to the prior work of Christ.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Moves from anxiety/false security to grounded hope.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: The hearer is a dependent being in a chaotic world rescued by a sovereign God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'cosmic storm' to 'suburban routine' is handled by linking the magnitude of Christ's sacrifice to the 'costliness' of daily Christian life.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'everyone can do something' and the total 'randomness' of the world.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: As our representative, he comes under his own judgment... raised victorious over evil and death.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'oil' is the competence, but its source is more linked to 'hope' than a personified Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is linked to the 'Void' and 'Death'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the primary narrative (Salvation) while calling the hearer to be the Subject of the secondary narrative (Witness).

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir (Must) in the ethical section.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase focus on the Spirit as the one who provides the 'oil' (Pouvoir).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Clarify that the 'premium oil' is a gift of the Spirit, not just a product of human 'seriousness'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Excellent; the opponent is properly cosmic.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that does not shy away from the 'heavy opponent' of death while maintaining God as the active Subject of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the Eliot/Auden quotes, Greimas reveals that these quotes serve to define the 'Opponent' as a cosmic force.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the historical Amos; semiotics shows how the 'prosperous people' actant is mapped onto the modern 'Fairfield County' actor.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'Subject-Switch' where the hearer realizes they cannot defeat the 'Storm' and must rely on the Subject (Christ) who was 'swept away' by it.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'The Ice Storm' and 'Fairfield County' to establish the initial actantial state of 'False Security' before deconstructing it.
